These are Mr Hodgson & Dr Wilson - both are 
indefatigable workers and their work will I feel 
sure reflect the greatest credit on the Expedition 
Both & especially the former are so privately 
circumstanced that an increase of salary would 
prove most acceptable - In view therefore of 
the reduction <s>the<\s> in the wages account that will be 
effected by the discharge of several men, I 
would recommend that these officers salaries 
should be increased by at least £50 per annum 
the suggestion is made entirely on my own initiative, 
neither of the officers having made any  mention of 
the matter. 
The 'Morning' arrived within 10 miles of the 
'Discovery' on January 23rd; she has since 
closed to about 6. Captain Colbeck reports 
the extraordinarily packed state of the  Ross sea 
and I do not doubt this explains the very 
late break up of the ice in our vicinity 
The course taken by Captain Colbeck and  his <s>action 
at the various depots seems to me to <\s> conduct 
of the 'Morning' seems to me to reflect the 
greatest possible credit on him. No better 
officer could have been chosen for the work and 
since his arrival here no effort has been spared 
by himself his officers or men in furthering our interests 
and hastening the despatch of stores 
<s>I made arrangements for their transferrence<\s>
